documentation.title: HEIM-Biobank Methodology Documentation
documentation.description: Complete technical documentation for reproducibility and peer review

mesh_to_gbd_mapping.description: Mapping from PubMed MeSH terms to GBD 2021 disease causes

validation.unmapped_rationale: Meta-categories for publications about methodology rather than specific diseases

limitations: MeSH terms may not capture all relevant publications (false negatives)
Some MeSH terms map to multiple GBD causes (potential double-counting)
Publication language limited to English-indexed PubMed entries

gap_severity.description: Weighted count of diseases with critical/high research gaps

burden_miss.description: Proportion of global DALYs not addressed by biobank research

capacity_penalty.description: Penalty for low publication volume relative to biobank size

High.description: Excellent alignment with global disease burden

Moderate.description: Some alignment, gaps in priority diseases

Low.description: Significant misalignment with global health priorities

sensitivity_analysis.description: Impact of varying component weights on EAS rankings
sensitivity_analysis.robustness_note: Rankings are stable across weight variations; UK Biobank remains top-ranked in all scenarios

tier_1_zero_publications.rationale: Complete absence of research represents critical gap

tier_2_category_thresholds.rationale: Infectious and neglected diseases have stricter thresholds due to higher global south burden

tier_3_burden_normalized.description: For diseases above threshold, score based on research intensity relative to burden

research_appropriateness.description: Filter identifying diseases appropriate for biobank-based research

highly_appropriate.criteria: Chronic diseases with genetic/environmental components amenable to cohort study

moderately_appropriate.criteria: Diseases where biobank data provides some insights but not primary research modality

limited_appropriateness.criteria: Acute conditions, injuries, or diseases requiring different study designs

research_appropriateness.rationale: Avoids penalizing biobanks for not researching diseases outside their methodological scope

disease_burden.source: IHME Global Burden of Disease Study 2021

confidence_intervals.description: Uncertainty estimates for EAS scores based on publication sampling variability

methodology.approach: Analytical approximation based on publication count and component score variance

narrow_ci.description: High confidence in score; biobank has substantial publication volume

moderate_ci.description: Moderate confidence; score may shift with additional data

wide_ci.description: Lower confidence; limited data increases uncertainty

caveats: CIs reflect statistical uncertainty only, not systematic biases
MeSH mapping errors not captured in CIs
Between-biobank comparisons should consider overlapping CIs

known_limitations: Publication counts may underestimate actual research due to MeSH indexing delays
Multi-biobank collaborations split across individual biobanks may inflate per-biobank counts
UK Biobank dominance (35.7% of publications) may skew aggregate statistics
Global South biobanks underrepresented in IHCC membership
EAS weights (0.4/0.3/0.3) are based on expert judgment, not empirical optimization
Research appropriateness categories are subjective classifications
